thread.title: Newcastle 2 Aston Villa 0: Yoan Gouffran and Henri Lansbury own goal move Toon back to the top
thread.title_full: Newcastle 2 Aston Villa 0: Yoan Gouffran and Henri Lansbury own goal move Toon back to the top

author: rforrester
title: Newcastle 2 Aston Villa 0: Yoan Gouffran and Henri Lansbury own goal move Toon back to the top
text:
EFL Table toppers Newcastle 2 Aston Villa 0: Yoan Gouffran and Henri Lansbury own goal move Toon back to the top 
Villa boss Steve Bruce is now 10 matches without a win in all competitions By Richard Forrester Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments HENRI LANSBURY provided definitive proof that luck DOES even itself out over the course of a season with an own goal. 
The Villa ace, signed from Nottingham Forest last month, enraged Newcastle fans for his role in the Toon’s 2-1 loss at the City Ground in December. PA:Press Association 5 Yoan Gouffran stabs home Newcastle’s first-half opener from a corner 
Lansbury was accused of making the most of two separate situations which led to red cards for Jonjo Shelvey and Paul Dummett, both of which were overturned. 
So how the Geordie faithful delighted when the 26-year-old gaffed to double Newcastle’s lead here, after Yoan Gouffran’s opener, and send the hosts back to the top of the Championship. 
Lansbury’s error also contributed to an alarming EIGHTH defeat in nine for Villa, who are now in a relegation battle given it is only a six-point gap to the drop zone. 
It made for another frustrating night for Villa’s Geordie chief Steve Bruce, particularly as his side bossed the first half. Reuters 5 Henri Lansbury bundled the ball into his own net with 30 minutes left on the clock 
Newcastle did not even muster a chance until they scored in the 42nd minute as Villa starved the supply line to Dwight Gayle by shutting down Shelvey. 
And the visitors had their chances. 
Birkir Bjarnason, the Icelander who helped embarrass England at the Euros and signed in January, somehow volleyed wide from a few yards out after being teed up by Scott Hogan’s looping header. 
While Jonathan Kodjia, deployed out left to accommodate Hogan, had a shot loop up off DeAndre Yedlin that looked to be floating in, only for Karl Darlow to tip over brilliantly. 
It would have been a shot in the arm for Darlow after his ‘Karlamity’ mis-kick against Norwich last week which played a part in Newcastle dropping points at Carrow Road. Getty Images Steve Bruce is feeling the heat with no wins in his last 10 matches related articles HEADS HELD HIGH Sutton 0 Arsenal 2: United's magical FA Cup run ends as Theo Walcott bags his 100th club goal in gritty encounter FA Cup live Sutton 0 Arsenal 2: Theo Walcott scores his 100th Gunners goal to add to Lucas Perez's opener at non-league side 'No class' Arsenal slammed after captain Theo Walcott embarrassingly forgets to exchange pennant with Sutton skipper ahead of FA Cup clash Lor Welcome Arsenal to open talks with Napoli star Lorenzo Insigne after sending scouts to watch him in action Team News Sutton United vs Arsenal team news: Arsene Wenger set to risk reserves in must-win game at Gander Green lane sutton special A look at how many league places are between Sutton United and Arsenal and the non-league side's FA Cup record Preview Sutton United vs Arsenal: What time does it kick-off, what TV channel is it on, and what is the latest team news? Vale Park Violence Bristol Rovers call for investigation as Port Vale matchday official 'arrested for assault of away fan' EMOTIONAL RETURN Andrea Pirlo 'to return to Juventus' once his New York City contract expires and Italian retires hot stuff Sutton keeper Wayne Shaw is famed for 'Roly-Poly Goalie' chilli sauce... and turned down NAKED photoshoot SCRATCH THE SURFACE How will Arsenal handle Sutton's unfamiliar 3G artificial pitch in must-win FA Cup clash Rad to be back United flop Radamel Falcao looks thrilled to return to Manchester as Monaco and City train ahead of Champions League showdown 
Gayle had to come off after 33 minutes with what looked to be a recurrence of the hamstring injury which had ruled the 20-goal striker out for five weeks previously. 
That would have been a big worry for Rafa Benitez but in the short term he was more concerned about how his toothless side would register a shot on target – let alone breach Villa’s untroubled backline. 
But even the die-hard Villa fans up in Level Seven of the Leazes’ End, who mocked their hosts with chants of ‘We sent you down twice’ in reference to their role in Newcastle’s two recent relegations, knew things were going a little too well for their side. Reuters 5 Henri Lansbury angered Newcastle fans after his role in Toon’s 2-1 defeat against Nottingham Forest earlier this season 
So few would have been surprised when Gouffran broke the deadlock with Newcastle’s first shot – as that has just been Villa’s luck this season. 
Matt Ritchie exchanged a short corner with Shelvey before whipping in a cross to the back post which Jamaal Lascelles attacked. 
A melee ensued as Villa failed to clear and from the wreckage emerged Gouffran to lash in from six yards. 
One became two on the hour as Lansbury suffered his embarrassing moment. PA:Press Association 5 Newcastle are back to the top of the Championship following the 2-0 victory 
Lascelles flicked Shelvey’s corner towards the near post guarded by Lansbury, who cleared it onto the post only for the ball to rebound back off him and into the net. 
That sparked chants of ‘Let’s all laugh at Lansbury’, while the goal-scorer announcement on the Tannoy cued the biggest cheer of the night. 
From then, it was all Newcastle, barring a super stop from Darlow when Bjarnason found himself clean through. 
Ritchie and Jack Colback both saw efforts denied by Sam Johnstone but by then the damage was done, as Benitez’s boys took another step in their journey back to the Promised Land. 
Villa’s night went from bad to worse as striker Hogan, signed for £12m in January, was carried off on a stretcher late on after twisting his ankle in the turf. 
It was terrible luck for Bruce and Hogan, who suffered two anterior cruciate ligament injuries earlier in his career, and led to six minutes of injury time.
